content.html:
Activity

You are walking along a beach, and your toe hits something hard. You reach down, grab onto a handle, and pull out a lamp! It is sandy. You start to brush it off with your towel. Poof! A genie appears.

He tells you, “Thank you for freeing me from that bottle! I was getting claustrophobic. You can choose one of these purses as a reward.”

  • Purse A, which contains $1,000 today. If you leave it alone, it will contain $1,200 tomorrow (by magic). The next day, it will be $1,400. This pattern of an additional $200 per day will continue.
  • Purse B, which contains 1 penny today. Leave that penny in there because tomorrow it will (magically) turn into 2 pennies. The next day, there will be 4 pennies. The amount in the purse will continue to double each day.
  1. How much money will be in Purse A after a 7-day week?  Enter your answer as a number rounded to the nearest cent.

Correct! After 7 days, Purse A will contain $2,400 because it grows by $200 each day for 7 days.

Try again.

The correct answer is 2400. After 7 days, Purse A will contain $2,400 because it grows by $200 each day for 7 days.

  1. How much money will be in Purse B after a 7-day week? Enter your answer as a number rounded to the nearest cent. 

Correct! Purse B will contain $1.28. It doubles each day for 7 days, so it will have \(1 \cdot 2^7\) or 128 cents (the 1 here represents the 1 cent for when the genie appeared).

Try again.

The correct answer is 1.28. Purse B will contain $1.28. It doubles each day for 7 days, so it will have \(1 \cdot 2^7\) or 128 cents (the 1 here represents the 1 cent for when the genie appeared).

  1. How much money will be in Purse A after two weeks? Enter your answer as a number rounded to the nearest cent.

Correct! After 2 weeks, Purse A will contain an additional $1,400 for a total of $3,800.

Try again.

The correct answer is 3800. After 2 weeks, Purse A will contain an additional $1,400 for a total of $3,800.

  1. How much money will be in Purse B after two weeks? Enter your answer as a number rounded to the nearest cent.

Correct! cPurse B will contain \(1 \cdot 2^{14}\) cents. This is 16,384 cents or $163.84.

Try again.

The correct answer is 163.84. Purse B will contain \(1 \cdot 2^{14}\) cents. This is 16,384 cents or $163.84.

  1. The genie later adds that he will let the money in each purse grow for three weeks. 

    1. How much money will be in Purse A in three weeks? Enter your answer as a number rounded to the nearest cent.

Correct! After 3 weeks, Purse A will have an additional $1,400 during the third week for a total of $5,200.

Try again.

The correct answer is 5200. After 3 weeks, Purse A will have an additional $1,400 during the third week for a total of $5,200.

    1. How much money will be in Purse B in three weeks? Enter your answer as a number rounded to the nearest cent.

Correct! Purse B will have 128 times as much money (compared to the end of two weeks) for a total of $20,971.52.

Try again.

The correct answer is 20971.52. Purse B will have 128 times as much money (compared to the end of two weeks) for a total of $20,971.52.

  1. Which purse contains more money after 30 days? Enter your answer as a number rounded to the nearest cent.

Correct! Purse B will have a lot more money. Purse A will have \(1,000+30 \cdot 200\) or $7,000, which is much less than the doubling purse has on day 21.

Try again.

Incorrect. Purse B will have a lot more money. Purse A will have \(1,000+30 \cdot 200\) or $7,000, which is much less than the doubling purse has on day 21.
